title: Suzume
author: Suzume
content: Hello everyone,,The basic rules of forum us you have to be full member to use avatar in your profile. But I've seen some accounts are useing avatar and their  rank is newbie, jr.member, and member.  we cannot use avatar in low rank profiles .. But I saw those accounts is wearing avatar in there profile.... Name of accounts.1. hook  Rank : Newbie   Total earned merit : 0 Trust : ( +0 / =0 / -0)   2. coinonymous Rank : Newbie Total earned merit : 0 Trust:  ( +0 /=0 /-0)  3. Paperweight Rank : Jr.Member  Total earned merit : 38 Trust: (+0 /=0 /-0)  4. Houdini  Rank: Member Total earned merit: 10 Trust: (+0 /=0 /-0)  5.  ericools Rank: Member Total earned merit: 10  Trust : (+0 /=0 /-0)

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: As you can see, these accounts were created a very long time ago. Back then, newbies were able to wear avatars.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: It's because they're an old newbie, AFAIK back in the days a newbie can wear an avatar, before a big change when merit requirement implemented in this forum.In addition you can see some users are still wearing an animated avatar, but now you can't. Even you're using GIF format image as your avatar, it will not be animated and the forum only show the first frame.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: Plaguedeath on April 26, 2023, 09:25:49 AMIt's because they're an old newbie, AFAIK back in the days a newbie can wear an avatar, before a big change when merit requirement implemented in this forum.No, it's way back then before merit system got added. Merit system is just about 5 years old. The wearing of avatar to newbies were change sometime when the forum was hacked, and the loophole when uploading an avatar were used[1], or maybe way older than the hack incident.[1] https://www.reddit.com/r/Bitcoin/comments/1nmdq4/bitcointalk_hacked

comments.author: Suzume
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on April 26, 2023, 09:43:41 AMNo, it's way back then before merit system got added.  All Id's which have been created before the introduction of merit system. All the old Id's that are currently active will get all the benefits that were available 5 years ago??

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: Suzume on April 26, 2023, 11:11:08 AMAll Id's which have been created before the introduction of merit system. All the old Id's that are currently active will get all the benefits that were available 5 years ago??For the merit system and new rank features, yes, this includes the new avatar features, (well, it's old already actually) which is only for full members above.

comments.author: Lida93
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on April 26, 2023, 09:25:11 AMAs you can see, these accounts were created a very long time ago. Back then, newbies were able to wear avatars. Just a little bit curious about this. So does that mean that since these accounts already had avatars on before the introduction of the sig. and avatar rule that the rule doesn't apply or affect their ranks already having avatar on before it's introduction. Or the forum is only waiting when the account owners must have removed their avatar themselves then can't put it on again, not untill they rise to the appropriate ranks to be able to put on avatar ?Just asking to know!!

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Quote from: Lida93 on April 26, 2023, 12:18:22 PMJust a little bit curious about this. So does that mean that since these accounts already had avatars on before the introduction of the sig. and avatar rule that the rule doesn't apply or affect their ranks already having avatar on before it's introduction. Or the forum is only waiting when the account owners must have removed their avatar themselves then can't put it on again, not untill they rise to the appropriate ranks to be able to put on avatar ?Just asking to know!!Quote from: Suzume on April 26, 2023, 11:11:08 AMAll the old Id's that are currently active will get all the benefits that were available 5 years ago??Not anymore, if they've wore avatar before the update that newbies can no longer wear avatar and they've never changed or removed it then it stays there. But then, even if they're old accounts and try to do that today, the feature of wearing avatar is no longer available to all of them. Those that you've seen have wore it and never changed/removed their avatar long time ago and that why it stays there.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.created_time: April 26, 2023, 01:18:40 PMLast edit: April 26, 2023, 02:06:39 PM by robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on April 26, 2023, 09:25:11 AMAs you can see, these accounts were created a very long time ago. Back then, newbies were able to wear avatars. SMF or small machine forum is the software forum that we are using, by default even a newly created account can upload an avatar he can choose from the gallery or upload his own until Theymos customized the forum, which you need to rank so you can upload your own image.   This is a default forum profile area of SMF software.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on April 26, 2023, 09:25:11 AMAs you can see, these accounts were created a very long time ago. Back then, newbies were able to wear avatars. Forum policies for avatars changed a few times.Bitcointalk's important historic changesThere are three times as I knew.Avatar changesAccepting default Bitcoin avatarsAvatars re-enabledAPNGs are now detectedAfter avatars were disabled for newbies, there are glitches which make old-era newbies are grandfather and can wear avatars if they don't take theirs off. Same is for animated avatars that were detected and disabled years ago. Nowadays, we can see some users wear animated avatars.

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: From all the members you have linked up there the last one @ericools was active in 2020 and all others were active way before that time but there is similarity between all of them that they have created account in year 2011 when there were no such restrictions to the newbie account so they must have updated Avatar at that time.The restrictions were added later on to newbie account by @theymos to prevent lot of things as forum witnessed lot of changes.But as they were already wearing the Avatars even after merit system implementation it was not removed but newly created accounts faced that restrictions.You would not find any account as newbie wearing avatar or posting images (leaving copper membership aside) after the system implementation by @theymos but they all are from past instances and you can't delete the existing one's.

comments.author: Hyphen(-)
comments.body: Quote from: Lida93 on April 26, 2023, 12:18:22 PMQuote from: OmegaStarScream on April 26, 2023, 09:25:11 AMAs you can see, these accounts were created a very long time ago. Back then, newbies were able to wear avatars. Just a little bit curious about this. So does that mean that since these accounts already had avatars on before the introduction of the sig. and avatar rule that the rule doesn't apply or affect their ranks already having avatar on before it's introduction. Or the forum is only waiting when the account owners must have removed their avatar themselves then can't put it on again, not untill they rise to the appropriate ranks to be able to put on avatar ?Just asking to know!!As you can see, all of the accounts mentioned by the OP are inactive. Only one of them was active after the merit system was implemented, but the rest were not active for long, which means that their avatars may have been on before the regulation for ranks below full member to wear avatar was implemented.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on April 26, 2023, 09:25:11 AMAs you can see, these accounts were created a very long time ago. Back then, newbies were able to wear avatars.  Thank you for this clear explanation and I believe the OP understands the reason why the aforementioned account had the avatars. And also from my own research, the activeness of the accounts are far date back. hook  Last Active: July 09, 2018, 07:06:36 AM coinonymous Last Active:   September 11, 2011, 11:54:45 AMPaperweight Last Active:   September 25, 2020, 07:11:23 PM Houdini   Last Active:   March 25, 2012, 03:30:40 PM  ericools  Last Active:   January 13, 2020, 10:08:19 PM Op though I like your question. Instead of ignoring what you don't know, you asked it and got a respond from then users. You have also helped others who did not know it before.

comments.author: Smartvirus
comments.body: 2011 and now is a very long time, 12years in between and a lot ha changed on the forum between then and now. Some of them is newbies not having to wear avatars. Perhaps you could try gor accounts created after the merit system was updated.These accounts from wu back 2011 could as well have been ranked up as legendary members or some of the top ranks around should they have been a little more active but, they evidently weren't and as such, they remain newbies still.The Puss in Boots avatar though, kiddy kiddy cat cat, mew!

comments.author: noormcs5
comments.body: Quote from: Mate2237 on April 26, 2023, 08:30:15 PMOp though I like your question. Instead of ignoring what you don't know, you asked it and got a respond from then users. You have also helped others who did not know it before.Really this is a very new information for me and i never knew there are old Newbie account who wore avatars back in the time when Avatar was allowed on Newbie status. However sad to see that none of those accounts are active now a days.Sometime i think why Theymos ban the avator for the Newbies and what is the disadvantage in Newbie wears an avatar ?

comments.author: Sexylizzy2813
comments.body: When I see that I find it funny and I ask myself why?I won't blame them but I think is because of over confidence which isn't proper when it come to this forum.I did it at first when I fit applied for a campaign think that if I wear their Avatar that they'd pick me, poor me, was a novice then but after I saw that sign CFNP I felt bad.So since then I said won't until I'm being accepted.To all newbies just wait for your time to come

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: With this thread, I found an answer to your question.Quote from: Rizzrack on December 03, 2020, 12:57:05 PMAvatars were disabled due to some kind of exploit back around October 2013.They were re-enabled in 2015 on April 1st (it wasn't a prank lol) and also the Full Member requirement was introduced.So regarding the UID range my educated guess would be 1 - 155000 So beyond this date October 2013, all members on this forum can able to wear avatars.  So they're here for a long time.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: Quote from: noormcs5 on April 26, 2023, 11:12:39 PMQuote from: Mate2237 on April 26, 2023, 08:30:15 PMOp though I like your question. Instead of ignoring what you don't know, you asked it and got a respond from then users. You have also helped others who did not know it before.Really this is a very new information for me and i never knew there are old Newbie account who wore avatars back in the time when Avatar was allowed on Newbie status. However sad to see that none of those accounts are active now a days.Sometime i think why Theymos ban the avator for the Newbies and what is the disadvantage in Newbie wears an avatar ?I have read some time again the reason why newbies could no longer allowed to wear avatar. You can check here to see more https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1008863.msg10948133#msg10948133. I like it in this way that newbies can not wear avatar and signature because they would over abuse it. theymos consider all the possible ways before stopping newbies to water avatar. Just the ancient ones would have been automatically remove. Or is it that, they are lefrover for future reference .

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: Suzume on April 26, 2023, 09:22:57 AMThe basic rules of forum us you have to be full member to use avatar in your profile. But I've seen some accounts are useing avatar and their  rank is newbie, jr.member, and member.  we cannot use avatar in low rank profiles .. But I saw those accounts is wearing avatar in there profile.... Let me tell you a secret... all this members you mentioned had a super special time machine so they could get back in time and get this avatars easily, and some members even scored animated avatars  Joke aside, it's not hard to rank up quickly if you are active and contributing forum, than you can add any avatar you want.

comments.author: Zoomic
comments.body: Quote from: Suzume on April 26, 2023, 09:22:57 AM  If any of these accounts are still active, they would be enjoying some privilege as newbies wearing avatar which would be envious by people like me. But they will only have to wear one avatar until they become full member, because if they try to change, they are blacked out
